subject: VAM Pro issues
description_text:
Hello,

I have Pro X Ultra pedals and I just added the VAM Pro Reactors
After a clean firmware flash of the control box the VAM Pro Reactors behave
exactly like they should, however after you hit the "Save" button after
doing a pedal calibration or making lighting changes the reactors stop
working properly. They either don't respond at all to a signal or they
never stop vibrating after a signal. When I do a manual firmware flash to
the control box again they work properly again. But now the calibration and
lighting settings are wrong. And then after doing those changes and hitting
save again the reactors go back to not working like they should.

This likely comes from an issue in the SimSonn Manager.

Is this a known issue that will be fixed in a future update?

Kind regards,

Roderick

conversations.body_text: Hi Roderick Griffioen,  Are you using the USB 3.0 (blue) port on the back of your computer? Please avoid using a USB hub. I have reported this issue to our software team and we aim to test it on Monday, after which we will provide you with a solution or updated software.

Hello,

Yes I’m using a USB3.0 port on my computer and I’ve tried many different alternatives as well. Through powered usb hubs or directly to the pcb. The issue remains the same. 

Thank you for looking into it!

Kind regards,

Roderick

>

Hi Roderick Griffioen,   If this happens, it indicates that the computer’s grounding is not reliable, possibly because a three-prong plug was not used with a three-prong wall outlet. You can refer to the post below: connect the computer case to the stand, and connect the control box to the metal screws on the pedals. This should resolve the disconnection issue.      https://github.com/SHWotever/SimHub/wiki/USB-Issues-Troubleshooting https://support.gomezsimindustries.com/portal/en/kb/articles/understanding-emi-and-grounding

Hello,

After extensive testing I cannot find any issue with grounding or EMI.
What I've done to rule it out: Connect the Ultra Pro Control Box Directly
to the motherboard with the supplied USB cable to a blue USB 3.0 port.
My PC's power cable shares the same earth as my FFB wheel and the supplied
VAM power supply (although this supplied cable is without earth).

When I flash the firmware manually (Settings, Update, Manual Update, Choose
proxultra.sfu) and then don't change any settings in the simsonn manager.
The haptics function exactly like they should.
Now when I go to calibrate the pedals or change the lighting settings and
hit save in the manager, the haptics instantly don't behave like they
should. I'm getting this result in both Simsonn manager testing of the
haptics and in simhub.
When I use simhub for example to do a feedback for shifting gears in both
the throttle and brake pedal. One of the 2 haptics will not behave properly
while the other does. And when I switch it to only use 1 of the 2 motors,
that single motor will also not behave (even when it was behaving before).

When I do the whole process of manually flashing the firmware again the
haptics behave properly again until I make changes in the settings. This
happens without me rebooting my PC or changing any cables. Nothing changes
on the power or cable side.

I've also ran a multimeter to check continuity to ground from the pedal to
the control box, and they are properly grounded together. The haptics are
isolated with plastic mounts from the pedals.

Kind regards,

Roderick


On Tue, Nov 11, 2025 at 5:46 AM support@simsonn.com

Hi Roderick Griffioen,  You can try connecting the computer case to a screw on the controller box using any wire, and also connect any screw on the controller box to the pedal. Please check if this resolves your issue.

Hello,

I've tried this as well and it is still the same issue. On a fresh firmware
flash the haptics behave perfectly. The moment I hit "save" after a
calibration or changing the light setup they no longer work properly.
No matter what USB cable I try, or USB port, or whatever.

Anything else I can try?

Roderick

On Sun, Nov 16, 2025 at 4:02 AM support@simsonn.com

Hi Roderick Griffioen,    Is your software version 2.1.2?  Please try uninstalling the local software and then download the latest version again from the official website.  If the issue persists, could you please record a short video of your operation? I will ask our engineers to check it, as we haven’t encountered this problem when adjusting the light settings.     You may send the video to me via Google Drive, and please make sure to grant access permission.
